What crops is this useful for?: The pesticide, Asulox Herbicide, is useful for Sugarcane, Turf, Ornamentals, Christmas Tree Plantings and Non-Cropland.
First aid information?: If the pesticide comes in contact with skin or clothing, remove contaminated clothing and rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. If it gets in the eyes, hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing. In case of emergency, contact the Rocky Mountain Poison and Drug Center at 1-866-673-6671.
What special restrictions are placed on: The pesticide should not be applied directly to water, or to areas where surface water is present or to intertidal areas below the mean high water mark. It should not be used in a manner that will contaminate resources. It should not be applied when weather conditions favor drift from treated areas. It should not be used to contaminate water by cleaning of equipment or disposal of wastes.
What PPE should I wear?: Applicators and other handlers must wear long-sleeved shirt and long pants, chemical-resistant gloves (such as Nitrile, Butyl, Neoprene, and/or Barrier Laminate), and shoes plus socks.
How, where, and on what crop should I us: Asulox Herbicide can be applied to either plant cane or cane grown from stubble. For ground applications, use 15 to 100 gallons of water per acre, depending on local practice. For aerial application, it should be mixed in 3 to 5 gallons of water per acre, except in Hawaii, where 5 to 10 gallons of water per acre should be used. The rates of Asulox Herbicide given are for broadcast applications. For spot treatments, use a 5% v/v Asulox spray (1 gallon per 20 gallons of water). Do not exceed 8 pints of Asulox per acre per treatment.
How does the product have to be stored o: The pesticide should be stored at temperatures above 20° F. Wastes resulting from the use of this product may be disposed of on site or at an approved waste disposal facility. The container should be triple rinsed or pressure rinsed before disposal.
